content:
I wonder how bdrop packaging handles theme screenshots (png). I just released a new version - with a new screenshot - and the release zip file ships with the new screenshot, but it wasn't updated in the regular install. I ran the normal Backdrop update via web UI. Anyone else experiencing this?

Background for this: I'm unhappy with the awkward display of theme screenshots on b-org (scale-and-crop). Personally, I don't think it's optimal for theme promotion, if the only images people can see are those cropped mini images.

This issue looks related to me: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/566

Theme screenshot should update if a new screenshot is put into the theme · Issue #566 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
I created a new theme using an old screenshot of Basis. I changed the screenshot and cut a new release, but the old screenshot is still showing up on BackdropCMS.org. Here is the new screenshot: ht...

Also kind of related (to the background): https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/567 .The backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org issue queue seems however to be the right place for improvements.

Include screenshots on the themes page. · Issue #567 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
Backdrop doesn't currently include what themes look like on the themes page, at https://backdropcms.org/themes As per docwilmot on forum discussion: We're working on adding more features an...
@Olaf Grabienski yeah, right, both issues are still pending.

Any idea if the problem with the screenshot not updated in locally installed themes is a known one?

Ah, wait, I can answer that myself - that was a problem with the update cache (Backdrop downloaded the old version again). There's a core Issue for that somewhere... Unrelated here.
